title: "Unacceptable": US On India 'Buying Russian Oil, Reselling' Amid Ukraine War
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Tuesday accused India of profiteering from its sharply increased purchases of Russian oil during the war in Ukraine, saying Washington viewed the situation as unacceptable.

title: CP Radhakrishnan To File Nomination For Vice President Today
content: The National Democratic Alliance (NDA) candidate for the Vice Presidential election, CP Radhakrishnan, is set to file his nomination on Wednesday at 11:00 am.

title: Trump Imposed Tariffs On India To Put Pressure On Russia: White House
content: US White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt on Tuesday (local time) said that US President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on India to deter Russia from pursuing the Ukraine conflict.

title: Putin Tired Of War But Possible He Doesn't Want A Deal, Says Trump
content: US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he hoped Vladimir Putin was going to "be good" and move forward toward ending the war in Ukraine, but conceded it was possible the Russian president doesn't want to make a deal.

title: "If I Can Get To Heaven...": Trump On Solving Russian-Ukraine War
content: Donald Trump said Tuesday that a Ukraine peace deal could boost his chances of getting to heaven -- joking that his odds of making it through the pearly gates are currently low.

title: Fact Check: Trump Says He Has Ended 7 Wars. The Reality Isn't So Clear Cut
content: President Donald Trump has projected himself as a peacemaker since returning to the White House in January, touting his efforts to end global conflicts.

title: India Won't Take First Step To Normalise Ties, Onus On Pak: Shashi Tharoor
content: India no longer has the appetite to take the first step in normalising ties with Pakistan after repeated betrayals, senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said on Tuesday.

title: "We Are Back": White House Launches Official TikTok Account
content: The White House launched a TikTok account on Tuesday, as President Donald Trump continues to permit the Chinese-owned platform to operate in the United States despite a law requiring its sale.

title: US Again Claims It Stopped India-Pak War Using "Trade Leverage"
content: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt on Tuesday once again claimed that US President Donald Trump has ended the military conflict between India and Pakistan.

title: Meet Ukrainian Designer Who Helped Zelensky Dress For Trump Meeting
content: On Monday, the lucky charm worked to set a warm tone for a White House meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump. Moments after Zelenskiy arrived, Trump complimented him on the suit.

title: France Calls Netanyahu Antisemitism Claim "Erroneous"
content: France on Tuesday slammed as "abject" and "erroneous" an accusation from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that President Emmanuel Macron's move to recognise a Palestinian state was fuelling antisemitism in his country.

title: Switzerland, Austria Say Ready To Host Putin For Ukraine Peace Talks
content: Switzerland and Austria said Tuesday that they would host Russian President Vladimir Putin if he came for talks on peace in Ukraine, despite the International Criminal Court's arrest warrant.

title: Punjab Police Arrest 2 More Operatives Of Babbar Khalsa Terror Module
content: Days after busting Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) terror module, Counter Intelligence Jalandhar has arrested two more operatives of the same module and recovered one 86P hand-grenade from their possession.

title: Over 50 Killed In Bus Collision In Western Afghanistan: Cops
content: More than 50 people were killed on Tuesday in western Afghanistan when a passenger bus carrying migrants recently returned from Iran collided with a truck and a motorcycle, local police and a provincial official said.

title: Over 50 Killed In Bus Collision In Western Afghanistan: Cops
content: More than 50 people were killed on Tuesday in western Afghanistan when a passenger bus carrying migrants recently returned from Iran collided with a truck and a motorcycle, local police and a provincial official said.

title: Nearly 800 Evacuated From 2 Mumbai Monorail Trains Stuck Amid Heavy Rain
content: Two monorail trains broke down in Mumbai this evening amid heavy rain, stranding hundreds of passengers.

title: Google Fined $36 Million Over Anti-Competitive Deals With Australia Telcos
content: Google has agreed to pay a Aus$55 million (US$36 million) penalty for striking "anti-competitive" deals to pre-install only its own search engine on Android mobile phones sold by two leading Australian telecoms firms.

title: Did Trump impose 'sanctions on India' to pressure Moscow? What White House said
content: Donald Trump increased tariffs on Indian goods. The White House stated this was to pressure Russia to end the Ukraine conflict. This followed meetings between Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Trump aims for trilateral talks with Vladimir Putin. India is concerned about replacing Russian oil imports. European leaders are reportedly grateful for Trump's insights into Russia's position.

title: Sexual violence against women: India calls out Pak‚Äôs 'hypocrisy' at UN
content: At a UN Security Council debate, India's representative Eldos Mathew Punnoos accused Pakistan of historical and ongoing sexual violence, particularly against minority women, dating back to the 1971 conflict.

title: 'Allow extra time for commute': Indigo issues advisory amid heavy rains in Mumbai
content: IndiGo issued a travel advisory due to expected heavy rain in Mumbai, potentially causing air traffic congestion and flight disruptions. Passengers are advised to check flight status and allow extra commute time. Mumbai has been experiencing intense rainfall, with the IMD issuing alerts and recording significant amounts of rain, leading to diversions and delays.

title: Govt's big move: HM Shah to table bills for PM, CMs removal for arrests on serious charges
content: Home Minister Amit Shah is set to introduce three bills mandating the resignation or removal of the Prime Minister, Chief Ministers, and ministers if they are detained for 30 consecutive days on allegations of offenses punishable by five or more years in prison.

title: Population crisis: Musk warns of collapse again; This country forecast to lose 1 mln people by 2025
content: Elon Musk is again warning about declining population. He says Japan will lose nearly a million people soon. Musk believes artificial intelligence can reverse this trend. He has been warning about this since the turn of the century. He also highlights the issue in countries like South Korea and Italy. Musk sees population collapse as a threat to civilization.

title: Bomb scare: 2 Delhi schools receive threat via email; alert sounded, probe launched
content: Two Delhi schools in Najafgarh and Malviya Nagar received bomb threat emails on Wednesday, following similar threats to other schools on Monday. The ‚ÄúTerrorisers 111 Group‚Äù demanded $5,000 in cryptocurrency, threatening blasts if unmet. Schools like DPS Dwarka were evacuated, and security agencies conducted thorough checks.

title: 'Imran Khan wasn't talented, used to shout at us': Wasim Akram
content: Wasim Akram lauded Imran Khan as the greatest captain he played under, highlighting Khan's pivotal role in shaping his career. Akram emphasized that Khan's success stemmed from relentless hard work and determination, exemplified by his willingness to reinvent his bowling action. Imran's leadership instilled confidence in the team, demanding full commitment and intolerance for complacency on the field.

title: Slammed! 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy'
content: Mohammad Kaif has voiced concerns over Axar Patel's removal as T20I vice-captain, replaced by Shubman Gill after a year's absence. Kaif emphasized that Patel deserved prior notification and an explanation for the decision, especially considering his crucial role in India's T20 World Cup 2024 victory. Patel's consistent all-round performance includes 531 runs and 71 wickets in 71 matches.

title: Apple's big India move: All iPhone 17 models Made in India for US; Trump could be reason why
content: Apple is set to manufacture all iPhone 17 models in India before their September launch, a first for the company, including the Pro versions. This shift, driven by tariff concerns and geopolitical tensions, aims to fulfill most US iPhone demand from India. The Tata Group will handle half of India's iPhone production, with exports already reaching $7.

title: 'Likes sports, but doesn't play games in politics': PM on NDA VP nominee CP Radhakrishnan
content: PM Modi endorsed NDA's vice-presidential candidate, CP Radhakrishnan, highlighting their long friendship and Radhakrishnan's dedication to public service. Modi urged opposition support, praising Radhakrishnan's integrity. The PM also celebrated India's improved credit rating and economic outlook, noting positive market response to recent reforms.

title: Real-money gaming ban a death knell for us: Industry
content: India's gaming industry faces a potential crisis as the government considers banning "online money games." Experts warn this could devastate the sector, jeopardizing 4 lakh companies, 2 lakh jobs, and significant investments and GST revenue. Gaming executives express concerns about winding down operations due to the lack of consultation and potential impact on domestic sports.

title: Afghanistan bus accident: Over 50 killed after vehicle collides with truck, motorcycle
content: A tragic accident in western Afghanistan claimed over 50 lives. A bus carrying refugees collided with a truck and motorcycle, resulting in a fire. Among the deceased were 17 children. The bus was transporting Afghan refugees recently deported from Iran. Authorities attribute the accident to excessive speed and negligence. The refugees had boarded the bus at the Islam Qala border crossing.

title: ‚ÄòRockets to Wall Street‚Äô: Musk‚Äôs teen prodigy leaves SpaceX; joins Citadel Securities
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy who previously worked at SpaceX, is now joining Citadel Securities as a developer in New York City. He chose the quantitative trading firm over AI labs and big tech companies, drawn to the fast-paced environment and intellectual challenges. Quazi will be working on global trading infrastructure, embracing Wall Street's meritocratic culture.

title: 'Will give view on Prez reference; won‚Äôt decide validity of TN guv verdict': SC
content: The Supreme Court is set to offer its opinion on the President's queries regarding the power to set timelines for governors and the President in assenting to bills. Despite objections from Tamil Nadu and Kerala, the court indicated it would proceed if significant legal questions are involved.

title: 'Coolie' BO day 6: Rajinikanth's film touches Rs 216 crore mark
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, had a strong opening during the Independence Day weekend, crossing Rs 200 crore in India. However, weekday collections have dipped amidst competition from 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR. Despite the slowdown, 'Coolie' has surpassed Rs 400 crore worldwide, showcasing Rajinikanth's continued box office power.

title: ‚ÄòIt was painful‚Äô: Dhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce
content: Dhanashree Verma has addressed her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, expressing her sadness and criticising his choice of attire at the hearing. Chahal's t-shirt, bearing the words ‚ÄúBe your own sugar daddy‚Äù, sparked controversy and social media backlash. Dhanashree revealed her emotional breakdown during the verdict and how the incident ultimately motivated her to move on.

title: Tyson Bagent shocks Chicago as Bears tout NFL‚Äôs best QB duo
content: Tyson Bagent, the underdog quarterback, stole the show at Chicago Bears' preseason game. He threw for 205 yards and a touchdown. Bagent's performance highlighted his potential. Coach Ben Johnson praised his confidence and decision-making. Bagent's rise provides the Bears with valuable quarterback depth. His success has transformed him from a fan favorite to a legitimate threat.

title: Andy Roddick defends Iga Swiatek; calls out disrespect after Cincinnati win
content: Andy Roddick swiftly defended Iga Swiatek after a social media user questioned her relevance following her Cincinnati Open victory against Jasmine Paolini. Roddick's one-word response, "Yes," on an Instagram post celebrating Swiatek's win, garnered praise from tennis fans. This support follows Roddick's earlier defense of Swiatek during her 2024 doping controversy, highlighting his consistent admiration for the Polish star's talent.

title: French streamer Jean Pormanove dies at 46, fans outraged
content: French streamer Jean Pormanove, known for his extreme IRL broadcasts, tragically died at 46, sparking grief and outrage. His death followed a grueling Kick marathon, raising concerns about unsafe streaming culture. Fans are sharing disturbing clips, igniting debate on platform accountability and creator safety in the face of toxic content.

title: At 105, Kerala man becomes 'digi-literate'
content: At 105, M A Abdullah Maulavi embraced digital literacy through Kerala's Digi Keralam project, overcoming his reliance on others for news during the pandemic. This initiative, part of the state's push for 100% digital literacy, trained him and 2.2 million others in smartphone use and e-services. Kerala is set to be declared a fully digi-literate state on August 21.

title: More than 1.07 crore people sterilised during Emergency; 60% above 'target: Govt
content: During India's National Emergency (1975-1977), over 10.7 million people were sterilised, exceeding government targets by 60%. The Justice Shah Commission, investigating Emergency excesses, revealed widespread complaints, including forced sterilisations and related deaths. States like Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Uttar Pradesh conducted the most sterilisations, driven by a focus on this single method and incentives/disincentives.

title: Jerry Jones recalls fans‚Äô outrage after buying Dallas Cowboys and firing Tom Landry
content: Jerry Jones faced intense backlash, including death threats, after buying the Dallas Cowboys in 1989 and firing beloved coach Tom Landry. The move, perceived as a betrayal by fans, was followed by hiring Jimmy Johnson and Jones taking on dual roles as president and general manager. Despite the initial outrage, Jones remained committed to reshaping the team's direction.

title: Cong guarantee schemes are straining Karnataka finances: CAG
content: The CAG has warned that Karnataka's guarantee schemes are straining state finances, reversing post-Covid recovery. These schemes, comprising 15% of revenue expenditure in 2023-24, contributed to a revenue deficit of Rs 9,271 crore. The fiscal deficit also widened significantly, increasing from Rs 46,623 crore to Rs 65,522 crore.

title: Relief for CBI judge arrested by ED for corruption
content: Suspended CBI judge Sudhir Parmar, arrested in a money-laundering scam, has received a clean chit from a departmental committee, according to a report by inquiry officer Nirbhow Gill. The report, yet to be accepted by the High Court administration, could be a setback for the Haryana Vigilance Bureau. Parmar was suspended in April 2023 and jailed for nearly three months.

title: 'War 2' box office collection day 6: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR-starrer mints over Rs 190 crore
content: Ayan Mukerji's 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr. NTR, initially impressed at the box office but experienced a significant drop after the holiday weekend. Despite the weekday crash, the film managed to cross Rs 190 crore in six days. Rajinikanth‚Äôs ‚ÄòCoolie,‚Äô released alongside, maintained box office dominance, surpassing 'War 2' in collections.

title: Acquisition of another 97 Tejas, 6 AEW&C aircraft gets CCS nod
content: India has approved the acquisition of 97 Tejas Mark-1A fighter jets and six AEW&C aircraft for approximately Rs 85,500 crore. This move aims to strengthen the Indian Air Force's capabilities amid challenges from China and Pakistan. The Tejas fighters will be produced by HAL, with deliveries expected to ramp up.

title: Taylor Swift drops Blake Lively from intimate album party
content: Taylor Swift's New York album celebration stirred buzz, notably for Blake Lively's absence, fueling speculation about a rift. Insiders claim the guest list for 'The Life of a Showgirl' event was meticulously curated, intentionally excluding Lively. This exclusion, given their past public friendship, raises questions about priorities and potential fallout from Lively's courtroom situation.

title: Pocso shouldn't be slapped on teens in love: SC
content: The Supreme Court of India has observed that love is not a crime, emphasizing that teenage romantic relationships should not be criminalized under the POCSO Act. Justices Nagarathna and Mahadevan highlighted the need to protect genuine affection between adolescents, cautioning against treating them as criminals when elopements occur.

title: 409mm in just 1.5 days: Mumbai crippled; 1 dead, 400 evacuated
content: Mumbai was severely disrupted by heavy rainfall on Tuesday, leading to the evacuation of 400 residents near the Mithi River and widespread waterlogging. Transportation was significantly affected, with flight diversions, train delays, and numerous bus route diversions. One person died from electrocution, and the city experienced its wettest August in five years, with continued showers expected.

title: Mother battles crocodile, saves 5-year-old son
content: In a harrowing incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, a five-year-old boy was snatched by a crocodile while playing near a drain. His mother, Maya, bravely fought the reptile, striking and clawing at it until it released her son. Both sustained injuries and are receiving medical treatment, while villagers demand increased safety measures to prevent future attacks.

title: Tom Brady‚Äôs rumoured flame Sydney Sweeney faces huge setback days
content: Tom Brady and Sydney Sweeney ignited romance rumors at Jeff Bezos' wedding in Venice, sparking fan interest due to their age difference. However, neither has confirmed the relationship. Sweeney, recently single after breaking up with her fiance, now faces a career setback as her new movie, "Americana," underperforms at the box office, marking her first flop in years.

title: NE's 1st trans doctor wins legal battle to have new identity in academic certs
content: Beoncy Laishram, Northeast India's first transgender doctor, secured a Manipur High Court victory, affirming her right to update academic certificates to reflect her female identity. The court mandated authorities to reissue certificates within a month, citing the Transgender Persons (Protection of Rights) Act, 2019. This ruling allows Beoncy to pursue her medical career without identity concerns.

title: ‚ÄòJust profiteering‚Äô: Trump admin's fresh salvo on India for Russian oil
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent criticized India's Russian oil purchases, deeming it "arbitrage" and accusing them of profiteering by reselling refined products.

title: Taylor Swift stays silent on Blake Lively; feud rumours swirl over new track
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively are reportedly not in contact. This follows Lively's involvement in a controversy. Sources say Swift has not spoken to Lively for months. Swift's new album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' includes a track titled 'Ruin The Friendship.' Fans speculate it is about Lively. The album is set to release on October 3, 2025.

title: Overcrowding, power glitch: Why Mumbai monorail got stuck? Over 400 rescued
content: In Mumbai, a monorail carrying over 400 passengers broke down between stations due to overcrowding during torrential rains, leading to a three-hour stranding. Rescue operations were promptly initiated by BMC, fire department, and police, ensuring the safe evacuation of all passengers, with some taken to hospitals as a precaution.

title: Bodies of 2 flash flood victims recovered in Rajouri and Poonch; Army rescues civilians
content: Tragedy struck Jammu as the bodies of two flash flood victims, including a young girl, were recovered in Rajouri and Poonch. Swift action by the Army saved several individuals stranded on an island in the Poonch River. Authorities have issued warnings urging caution due to ongoing weather challenges in the border districts.

title: Now, flood of severed limbs spooks Chasoti
content: The devastating flash floods in Chasoti, Kishtwar, have claimed over 140 lives, with the confirmed death toll at 68 and 72 still missing. Rescue teams are now focused on recovering bodies and body parts. Doctors and villagers are shaken by the sheer number of severed limbs found.

title: Desmond Watson waits for clearance as Buccaneers hold rookie out until weight loss goal
content: Desmond Watson, the heaviest NFL player, is working to lose weight. The Tampa Bay Buccaneers rookie is currently sidelined. He joined the team in April 2025. Watson is collaborating with a nutritionist. He is doing conditioning in Florida's heat. Coach Todd Bowles wants him healthier. The team hopes to have a plan for Watson soon.

title: Doda admin limits Kailash Kund Yatra due to rough weather, cloudburst tragedies
content: Due to severe weather and recent cloudburst tragedies in Jammu and Kashmir, the Doda district administration has curtailed the Kailash Kund Yatra in Bhaderwah. The three-day pilgrimage, scheduled from August 20-22, will now be symbolic, prioritizing devotee safety. Women and children are restricted from participating. Pilgrims must carry valid ID, and the Chattergala route is off-limits.

title: Royal Navy gets its first Hindu chaplain
content: Bhanu Attri, raised in India and now residing in Essex, has made history as the Royal Navy's first Hindu chaplain. He recently graduated from Britannia Royal Naval College, marking a significant step towards religious diversity within the naval service.

title: UK: man convicted of shooting Kerala girl in head, permanently injuring her
content: Javon Riley has been convicted for his involvement in the shooting of a nine-year-old girl from Kerala in Dalston. The innocent victim was struck by a bullet during a gang-related attack on a Turkish restaurant, leaving her with permanent brain injuries.

title: Asia Cup snub: Shreyas Iyer given fresh backing - 'There is no doubt in my mind'
content: Despite Shreyas Iyer's strong IPL performance and upcoming Asia Cup, selectors omitted him from the squad. Irfan Pathan strongly believes Iyer will return to the T20 team and become a leader. Iyer's impressive post-T20 World Cup stats include 949 runs in 26 matches, averaging 49.94 with a 179.73 strike rate, highlighting his potential impact.

title: Indians on H-1B: Where will they go if they lose jobs in the US?
content: For Indian professionals on H-1B and L-1 visas, the American dream is increasingly uncertain. Visa restrictions, sudden policy shifts, and political rhetoric are reshaping career and life choices. A Blind poll shows 45% would return to India if laid off, drawn by family, cultural ties, and tech opportunities, while regulatory changes and professional risks continue to complicate long-term planning.

title: Ex-Panthers star urges Team Canada to join Crosby, McDavid at 4 Nations
content: Brandon Montour aims for a spot on Team Canada for the 2026 Winter Olympics. After winning the Stanley Cup, he is eager to represent his nation. Montour missed the 4 Nations roster but is determined to prove his worth. He attended Canada‚Äôs Olympic orientation camp. He hopes to play alongside Sidney Crosby and Connor McDavid.
